newsitem.title: UK: UK Labour's Brown promises tough spending approach.
newsitem.headline: UK Labour's Brown promises tough spending approach.

text.p: Britain's opposition Labour Party will not look to increase public spending beyond what the Conservative government already plans in the first two years of office, economics spokesman Gordon Brown said on Monday.
"Our first budget will not reopen overall spending allocations (for government departments) for the 1997-8 financial year," Brown said in a keynote speech on public finance.
"These are the figures upon which departments are already planning, and should continue to plan."
He added that for the 1998-9 financial year, spending would be changed in line with Labour's priorities, but would not be increased.

"Instead of our departments spending the first year of a Labour government debating how to spend more money, they will use their time examining how they can reorder existing budgets to meet our priorities," Brown said. -- London Newsroom +44 171 5427767
